titleStmt.title: By the King. A proclamation for the restraint of the consumption of the coyne and bullion of this realme, and the deceitfull making of gold and siluer threed, and for the regulating thereof for the time to come.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

publicationStmt.publisher: by Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Maiestie: and by the assignes of Iohn Bill,

notesStmt.note: Dated at end: ... VVhitehall, the eighteenth day of Ianuary, in the eleuenth yeere of Our reigne.
The dates are given according to Lady Day dating.
Arms 24; Steele notation: consumpti- or 2) impor- 3) said Premisses,.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
